the lab bookshelf notebook about me
eigenface facial recognition
  • i had done a few projects here and there but this was my first big undertaking, i decided to do facial recognition because it just sounds really cool
  • the eigenface route came from one of my uni modules (linear algebra) but i ended up chucking myself in the deep end and confusing myself even more haha
  • principal component analysis can be used to turn face images into compact eigenfaces that still keep the important info.
  • even a traditional method like eigenfaces can get solid results (around 89% on a standard face dataset).
  • visualizing the mean face and eigenfaces makes it way easier to understand what the model is learning.
  • a simple nearest neighbor classifier in eigenface space is enough to do basic face recognition.
predicting SPY returns with a hybrid LR + LSTM Model
  • it’s a hybrid model that tries to predict next day returns for the SPY ETF using linear regression plus an LSTM to capture patterns the linear model misses
  • my aim going into this was to simply complete the project, a huge struggle of mine
  • they start with a baseline linear regression on engineered features like momentum and volatility
  • then they train an LSTM on the regression residuals to see if it can add predictive power
  • the hybrid didn’t beat the baseline in directional accuracy, but it was a super fun and challenging project
  • working through the entire pipeline was hard at my level, but i found the data cleaning SO infuriating; definitely a learning experience
